snippet: The “blockbuster part” court has reduced the number of pending felony cases more than two years old by more than half in the last 11 months.
abstract: Court officials say judges and prosecutors in the Bronx have reduced crippling backlog of felony cases by more than half in last 11 months, but borough’s courts still lag behind rest of New York City in dispensing justice; gains come nearly one year after New York State Chief Justice Jonathan Lippman started program to eliminate backlog.
lead_paragraph: The “blockbuster part” court has reduced the number of pending felony cases more than two years old by more than half in the last 11 months.

headline.main: Bronx Courts Make Gains in Reducing Case Backlog
headline.print_headline: Bronx Courts Make Gains In Reducing Case Backlog
